thread.title: Trump discusses Russia with Ukrainian President Poroshenko - Washington Examiner
thread.title_full: Trump discusses Russia with Ukrainian President Poroshenko - Washington Examiner

title: Trump discusses Russia with Ukrainian President Poroshenko - Washington Examiner
text:
President Trump spoke with Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko for the first time since moving into the White House on Saturday, as violence in eastern Ukraine has spiked over the past week. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon) Trump discusses Russia with Ukrainian President Poroshenko By Kelly Cohen ( @politicohen_ ) • 2/4/17 6:59 PM Kelly Cohen Criminal Justice Reporter The Washington Examiner http://s3.amazonaws.com/content.washingtonexaminer.biz/images/static/authors/HeadshotCohen_Kelly.jpg More 
President Trump spoke with Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko for the first time since moving into the White House on Saturday, as violence in eastern Ukraine has spiked over the past week. 
According to the White House, the two leaders spoke over the phone at 5 p.m. Saturday on a variety of conflicts — including Russia. 
"We will work with Ukraine, Russia, and all other parties involved to help them restore peace along the border," said Trump in a statement. 
The need to diplomatically resolve the conflict between Ukraine and Russia was discussed, according to a statement from Poroshenko. 
Subscribe today to get intelligence and analysis on defense and national security issues in your Inbox each weekday morning from veteran journalists Jamie McIntyre and Jacqueline Klimas. Sorry, there was a problem processing your email signup. Please try again later. Processing... Thank you for signing up for the Daily on Defense newsletter. You should receive your first issue soon! 
"The two sides discussed strengthening the strategic partnership between Ukraine and the United States," the statement said, adding, "Particular attention was paid to the settlement of the situation in the Donbass (in eastern Ukraine) and achieving peace via political and diplomatic means." 
At least 34 people were killed this week after Ukrainian troops clashed with Russian-backed separatists. At least 9,800 people have been killed since the conflict in eastern Ukraine began in April 2014. 
Trump has also expressed a desire to improve relations with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The two leaders spoke last week. 
Trump also had a phone conversation Saturday with Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni. The two discussed a variety of issues including combating terrorism, dealing with refugees and reiterating commitment to NATO. Trump also agreed to attend the G-7 Summit in Taormina, Italy in May. Also from the Washington Examiner
